subject: World Cup (Skiing)
lead_paragraph: The Olympic slalom champion Anja Paerson won a women’s World Cup super-G in Switzerland on Sunday for her second victory in 24 hours.Paerson finished the Corviglia course in 1 minute 15.06 seconds to edge Canada’s Emily Brydon by 0.04. Renate Goetschl was third.“It’s just amazing,” Paerson said. “Yesterday, I was just thinking about getting across the finish line because this is such a tough super-G course.”Julia Mancuso lost half a second in the final interval but still posted the top American result, tying for 10th with Canada’s Britt Janyk in 1:15.57.
